title: Medication Safety Competency Training for Nursing Practitioners (Based on the 4C/ID Model)

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: A medication safety education program for practicing nurses, emphasizing integrated knowledge and technical competencies through the 4C/ID model, with project-based assessments conducted in a digitally supported environment.

learning_goals: Learners can identify over 90% of the eight major medication errors that may occur during oral and injectable medication processes through simulation-based training according to the 4C/ID model
Learners can develop 100% patient-tailored medication plans through analysis of drug interaction and adverse effect cases
Learners can apply medication safety protocols to actual clinical cases with over 85% accuracy through reflective journaling and team-based problem-solving
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
